Field.Heading: Name filter
Field.Help: Will show only those parameters which matches (partly or fully)the filter string

Field.Heading: Flag filter
Field.Help: Will show only those parameters which matches the Unit Type parameter flag.

Field.Heading: Type filter
Field.Help: Will show parameters based upon if they are configured or not configured.

Field.Heading: Parent Group
Field.Help: A group may inherit another group's criteria. The critera of the parent group will be ANDed together with this group's criteria. If the parent specifies a profile, this group will inherit the profile requirement.

Field.Heading: Profile
Field.Help: A group may specify a profile requirement, to reduce the group search within a profile, instead of within the unittype.

Field.Heading: Time rolling parameter
Field.Help: The parameter which will contain the time rolling criteria of this group. The parameter should be a System parameter, preferrably a System parameter custom made for this purpose.

Field.Heading: Time rolling format
Field.Help: The format can be either date or date+hour. This means that the time parameter criteria will change every day or every hour. The agent responsible for changing the time criteria is the xAPS Core module, so make sure to run the group report (see xaps-core.properties) as often as you like to change the time criteria.

Field.Heading: Time rolling offset
Field.Help: The time critera may change to a day in the future, instead of the current time. Specify the number of days in advance it will be changed to. The idea behind this feature is to allow a job to work on a group when some time has passed.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.MAC
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: MAC
Parameter.Help: The parameter should contain the WAN MAC address of the device. In some cases it will contain the serialnumber instead. The parameter should be populated by the server on the first provisioning.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.PeriodicInterval
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: PeriodicInterval
Parameter.Help: The parameter should contain the number of seconds from the last provisioning to the next provisioning. The parameter is populated on every provisioning of the device.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.PublicIPAddress
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: PublicIPAddress
Parameter.Help: The parameter should contain the public IP address of the device. The device is not necessarily reachable on this address, since it could be behind a NAT-gateway.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.SoftwareVersion
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: SoftwareVersion
Parameter.Help: The parameter should contain the software version of the device.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.FirstConnectTms
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: FirstConnectTms
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the timestamp of the first contact between the server and the device. It doesn't necessarily mean that there has been a successful provisioning.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.LastConnectTms
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: LastConnectTms
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the timestamp of the latest contact between the server and the device. It doesn't necessarily mean that there has been a successful provisioning.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Secret
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Secret
Parameter.Help: The secret which authorizes the provisioning session.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Debug
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Debug
Parameter.Help: If set to "1" it will cause xAPS to run in debug-mode for this particular unit. Default is "0".

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.DesiredScriptVersion
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: DesiredScriptVersion
Parameter.Help: The desired script version can be set (in conjunction with ScriptURL) to order an upload of a script to the device.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.DesiredSoftwareVersion
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: DesiredSoftwareVersion
Parameter.Help: The desired software version can be set (in conjunction with SoftwareURL) to order an upload of a software (firmware) to the device.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.IM.Message
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Message
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains information regarding inspection mode. Internal usage.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Job.Current
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Job.Current
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the ongoing job id for this unit.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Job.Disruptive
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Job.Disruptive
Parameter.Help: If set to "1" the parameter indicates that a job in this job chain is disruptive, hence all sub-sequent jobs must run regardless of servicewindow restrictions. Default is "0". Internal usage.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Job.History
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Job.History
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the job history of the unit. The format is (,job-id:repeat-counter:last-run-tms)*. Internal usage.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ProvisioningMode
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: ProvisioningMode
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the provisioning mode. The default mode is "PERIODIC". "INSPECTION" is used in inspection mode. Internal usage.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ProvisioningState
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: ProvisioningState
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the provisioning state. The default mode is "READY", but in inspection mode other states are used (LOAD, LOADING, STORE, STORING). Internal usage."

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Restart
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Restart
Parameter.Help: Set to "1" to trigger a restart of the device. As soon as the restart has been provisioned, the parameter is set to "0", which is default.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ScriptURL
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: ScriptURL
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains a URL which the device may download a script to perform on the device.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.SecretScheme
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: SecretScheme
Parameter.Help: The parameter is only used in TFTP and HTTP provisioning. If set to "ENCRYPTED" the provisioning will be encrypted.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Disruptive
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Disruptive
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the regular service window. Default is blank (interpreted as mo-su:0000-2400). The service window format is weekday-weekday:hour-hour, an example are mo-fr:0800-1500.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Enable
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Enable
Parameter.Help: If set to "0", service window is not enabled. Default is blank (interpreted as "1").

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Frequency
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Frequency
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the number of provisionings pr week. Default is blank (interpreted as 7).

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Regular
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Regular
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the regular service window. Default is blank (interpreted as mo-su:0000-2400). The service window format is weekday-weekday:hour-hour, an example are mo-fr:0800-1500.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Spread
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Spread
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains a spread-factor (default is blank (interpreted as 50) which tells how many percent the randomization of the spread will be. If set to 0, no spreading of the periodic inform interval will occur.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.SoftwareURL
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: SoftwareURL
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains a URL which the device may download a software (firmware) to upgrade/downgrade the device.
